title: (x) "Graham" bold block face w/ open R - ITC Eras {self}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805012351im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Find%20Font_6725.jpg)
  
Any help will be much appreciated!
author: jamiejjp

comments.content: Strangely un-obliqued. Why not just use a roman font?

There was an upright version of Eras that supposedly came with certain models of printers back in the day. It could be that.

- Lex
Yup, that was in the days that laser printers had a lower resolution. They also had a version of Syntax without the slight slant and Optima with straight sides.
